newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-MONACO WIN, OPEN FOUR-POINT LEAD.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-MONACO WIN, OPEN FOUR-POINT LEAD.

text.p: Monaco scored three times in the first half to beat Lens 3-1 away on Friday and open a four-point lead in the French first division.
Challengers Paris Saint-Germain lost ground when they were held 1-1 at home by Montpellier.
The leaders, who scored through Nigeria's Victor Ikpeba, Gilles Grimandi and Brazilian Anderson, have 48 points, PSG 44 and Bastia, 3-1 winners over Bordeaux on Thursday, 42 in third place.
Champions Auxerre crashed to their second successive defeat, 1-0 at home to Strasbourg.
Rennes striker Stephane Guivarc'h hit a hat-trick as his side came from behind to beat Marseille 4-2 and took his tally as the division's top scorer to 17.
Former Marseille striker Tony Cascarino of Ireland also scored three as relegation-threatened Nancy won 3-1 at Le Havre. But they remained one place from bottom.

Four players were sent off in nine matches, while Lyon's goalkeeper Pascal Olmeta punched team mate Jean-Luc Sassus after their 1-0 home loss to Nantes and the defender was taken to hospital with concussion.
The league now goes into winter recess until the last weekend of January when Monaco and PSG clash in a top-of-the-table encounter in the principality.
